results.title: Shearing time at Billabong
results.creator_credit: Australian Wool Corporation and Frank Land
results.brief_description: Australia’s 120 million sheep are scattered all over the continent wherever there is green grass and water. Billabong Station, in the hot dry interior, depends upon a nearby billabong to supply water to moisten the fertile soil. On the station property 40,000 sheep graze and each summer, shearing at Billabong commences. Gangs of shearers travel from far and wide to work at Billabong. The sheep are mustered by men and their dogs, sent through the drafting yards and into the shearing shed. The wool taken from the shearers is skirted, sorted, and pressed into 300-lb bales - and sent on its way to the sales. After that, Australia’s wool goes to the world.

results.title: Shearing technique
results.brief_description: A demonstration showing correct methods of shearing sheep. A shearer demonstrates the most common faults found in shearing and slow-motion “shots” help to emphasise the important points of good shearing.

results.title: She wore a yellow ribbon
results.creator_credit: John Ford, RKO Radio Pictures and Merian C. Cooper
results.brief_description: Considered one of John Ford’s finest Westerns, “She wore a yellow ribbon” is the epic tale of cavalry life on the harsh American frontier. John Wayne is Captain Brittles, about to retire from the cavalry, but called back by his troops to defend them from the Apache Indians who have declared Holy War on the white man. Only Brittles has enough knowledge of Apache life to devise a strategy which will prevent a bloody massacre. The stunning locations are in Monument Valley and the cinematography won an Academy Award for Winton C. Hoch. Also starring John Agar, Joanne Dru, Victor McLaglen and Ben Johnson.

results.title: She shall be called woman
results.brief_description: Depicts the position of women in primitive African societies. As Biblical texts concerning the creation of women, her place in society, and her influence on the affairs of mankind through the ages are read, the ideas are visualised through selected primitive African sculpture.

results.title: She's a woman: a media portrait
results.creator_credit: Film House Tv, Peter Beilby, Marianne Latham and Sue Cram
results.brief_description: This documentary deals with the issue of the way women are represented by the media, particularly television, whether it be in advertising, news items, drama series, quiz show hostess or contestant. Stereotype roles even carry down to children who feature in television advertising. However, it also covers the gradual breaking down of the traditional rules of sex roles including women in sport, women employed in male occupations, women becoming members in male dominated clubs and entering those hallowed domains which once used to be reserved for men only. Includes interviews with Bettina Arndt, Abigail, Dr Patricia Edgar, Phillip Adams, Patsy Adam Smith and others and contains advertising images, archival footage (including the Melbourne Cup fashion parades and Miss Australia Quest) and early newsreels. Although made in 1984, it is still very relevant and of great historical value. Narrated by Sigrid Thornton.

results.title: She's a railroader
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Shelah Reljic, John Taylor and Barbara Tranter
results.brief_description: Karen Zaitchik jumps on and off moving boxcars, throws switches, pulls brakes and uncouples freights with ease and confidence. She’s a railroader for CN and that’s what this 21-year-old highly individualistic woman wants out of life for the moment. This colorful short film shows how Karen manages in the traditionally male world of the railroad.

results.title: Shchors
results.creator_credit: Kiev Film Studio and Oleksandr Petrovych Dovzhenko
results.brief_description:
A depiction of the exploits of the Ukrainian civil war commander Nikolai Shchors (under whom director Dovzhenko served). The film opens during the 1918 German intervention in the civil war. Ukrainians partisans form a brigade known as the Boguns and join with the Tarashchansk regiment to oppose German and Rada forces. Thematically, the film is a heroic mission, a quest and biography of a civil war leader who was a Bolshevik icon. Stalin commissioned this film to be made and took a participatory role in the film’s production and direction. A protracted shoot proved taxing to Dovzhenko who was forced to submit every creative idea and episode for political approval. Despite its socialist-realist approach, the film contains poetic and memorable images typical of Dovzhenko’s style.

Credits: Director, writer, Alexander Dovzhenko ; photography, Y. Ekelchik ; music, Ukrainian State Symphony Orchestra.
Cast: Yevgeni Samoilov, Ivan Skuratov, N. Nikitina, L. Lyashenko.

results.title: Shaw versus Shakespeare. Part 1: the character of Caesar
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and John Barnes
results.brief_description: George Bernard Shaw, played by Donald Moffatt, analyses Shakespear’s characterisation of Julis Caesar and compares it with his won treatment. Shaw claims the character of Caesar was beyind Shakespeare, but admits Shakespear is still the “King of the dramatists”.

results.title: Shattered dreams
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Dale Phillips and Wendy Hill-Tout
results.brief_description: Schizophrenia is a disease shrouded in ignorance and myth. This confronting and emotional film details the story of the Martini family who had two sons diagnosed with the disease. Clem Martini, a third brother, narrates the film and through his words we come to understand the grief and pain experienced by the schizophrenics and their families and friends. Passionate and illuminating, “Shattered Dreams” argues for an increased public knowledge of schizophrenia and mental illness.

results.title: Sharpening and tempering farm tools
results.brief_description: Explains how to treat carbon-steel tools for forge sharpening; how to sharpen, harden and temper a cultivator and a ploughshare shovel; how to identify tempering colours. From the series “Farm work forging”.
